title: Resident Docs Raise Objection To New Ayush Clinic At Nims | Hyderabad News - Times of India
author: TNN; Sep 1
description: Hyderabad: The Resident Doctors Association (RDA) at the Nizam's Institute of Medical Sciences (NIMS) took strong objection to health minister T Haris.
cleaned_text: (RDA) at the Nizam's Institute of Medical Sciences (NIMS) took strong objection to health minister T Harish Rao inaugurating an integrated AYUSH wellness centre at the hospital on Thursday. "We have urged NIMS administration to prioritise evidence-based practices and uphold the sanctity of scientific medicine. There is no place for alternative medicine practice in an allopathic hospital. We call on the health minister and hospital administration to reconsider and disengage AYUSH clinics from NIMS and any state-run allopathic hospitals," said RDA president Dr Zeeshan. Doctors association further said that though Ayurveda and homoeopathy have their merits, they lack the extensive clinical validation and research that modern medicine demands. "Integrating these principles within the institute might compromise patient care, mislead patients and dilute the standards that NIMS is known for," read a statement from RDA.
